verses.text: Plead \add my cause\add*, O \sc Lord\sc*, with them that strive with me: Fight against them that fight against me.
Take hold of shield and buckler, And stand up for mine help.
Draw out also the spear, and stop \add the way\add* against them that persecute me: Say unto my soul, I \add am\add* thy salvation.
Let them be confounded and put to shame that seek after my soul: Let them be turned back and brought to confusion that devise my hurt.
Let them be as chaff before the wind: And let the angel of the \sc Lord\sc* chase \add them\add*.
Let their way be dark and slippery: And let the angel of the \sc Lord\sc* persecute them.
For without cause have they hid for me their net \add in\add* a pit, \add Which\add* without cause they have digged for my soul.
Let destruction come upon him at unawares; And let his net that he hath hid catch himself: Into that \add very\add* destruction let him fall.
And my soul shall be joyful in the \sc Lord\sc*: It shall rejoice in his salvation.
All my bones shall say, \sc Lord\sc*, who \add is\add* like unto thee, Which deliverest the poor from him that is too strong for him, Yea, the poor and the needy from him that spoileth him?
False witnesses did rise up; They laid to my charge \add things\add* that I knew not.
They rewarded me evil for good \add To\add* the spoiling of my soul.
But \add as for\add* me, when they were sick, my clothing \add was\add* sackcloth: I humbled my soul with fasting; And my prayer returned into mine own bosom.
I behaved myself as though \add he had been\add* my friend \add or\add* brother: I bowed down heavily, as one that mourneth for his mother.

But in mine adversity they rejoiced, and gathered themselves together: \add Yea\add*, the abjects gathered themselves together against me, and I knew \add it\add* not; They did tear \add me\add*, and ceased not:
With hypocritical mockers in feasts, \add They\add* gnashed upon me \add with\add* their teeth.
Lord, how long wilt thou look on? Rescue my soul from their destructions, My darling from the lions.
I will give thee thanks in the great congregation: I will praise thee among much people.
Let not them that are mine enemies wrongfully rejoice over me: \add Neither\add* let them wink \add with\add* the eye that hate me without a cause.
For they speak not peace: But they devise deceitful matters against \add them that are\add* quiet in the land.
Yea, they opened their mouth wide against me, \add And\add* said, Aha, aha, our eye hath seen \add it\add*.
\add This\add* thou hast seen, O \sc Lord\sc*: keep not silence: O Lord, be not far from me.
Stir up thyself, and awake to my judgment, \add Even\add* unto my cause, my God and my Lord.
Judge me, O \sc Lord\sc* my God, according to thy righteousness; And let them not rejoice over me.
Let them not say in their hearts, Ah, so would we have it: Let them not say, We have swallowed him up.
Let them be ashamed and brought to confusion together that rejoice at mine hurt: Let them be clothed with shame and dishonour that magnify \add themselves\add* against me.
Let them shout for joy, and be glad, that favour my righteous cause: Yea, let them say continually, Let the \sc Lord\sc* be magnified, Which hath pleasure in the prosperity of his servant.
And my tongue shall speak of thy righteousness \add And\add* of thy praise all the day long.
